Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.name: type
Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.abstract: Contains the type of the public key credential the caller is referring to

Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.name: rawId
Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.abstract: A string represented by the credential identifier.

Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.name: id
Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.abstract: Contains the credential ID of the public key credential the caller is referring to

Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.name: response
Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.abstract: Contains the authenticator’s response to the client’s request to either create a public key credential, or generate an authentication assertion.

Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.name: getClientExtensionResults
Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.abstract: Contains the results of processing client extensions requested by the Relying Party

Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.name: getTransports
Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.abstract: Contains a hint as to how the client might communicate with the managing authenticator of the public key credential the caller is referring to.

Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.name: ClientExtensionResults
Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html#/s:10IB.abstract: Client extensions requested by the Relying Party.

Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.name: clientDataJSON
Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.abstract: Passed to the authenticator by the client in order to generate this assertion.

Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.name: authenticatorData
Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.abstract: Contains the authenticator data returned by the authenticator.

Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.name: signature
Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.abstract: Contains the raw signature returned from the authenticator

Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.name: userHandle
Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.abstract: Contains the user handle returned from the authenticator, or null if the authenticator did not return a user handle.

Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.name: encode(to:)
Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.abstract: Encodes this value into the given encoder.

Structs/AuthenticatorAttestationResponse.name: clientDataJSON
Structs/AuthenticatorAttestationResponse.abstract: Passed to the authenticator by the client in order to generate this credential.

Structs/AuthenticatorAttestationResponse.name: attestationObject
Structs/AuthenticatorAttestationResponse.abstract: Contains an attestation object, which is opaque to, and cryptographically protected against tampering by, the client. The attestation object contains both authenticator data and an attestation statement.

Structs/AuthenticatorAttestationResponse.name: encode(to:)
Structs/AuthenticatorAttestationResponse.abstract: Encodes this value into the given encoder.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialDescriptor.ht.name: type
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialDescriptor.ht.abstract: An enumeration for defining valid credential types.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialDescriptor.ht.name: id
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialDescriptor.ht.abstract: The credential ID of the public key credential the caller is referring to.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialDescriptor.ht.name: transports
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialDescriptor.ht.abstract: An array of transport type that can communicate with the client.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialParameters.ht.name: type
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialParameters.ht.abstract: The type of credential to be created.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialParameters.ht.name: alg
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialParameters.ht.abstract: The cryptographic signature algorithm with which the newly generated credential will use.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialParameters.ht.name: init(from:)
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialParameters.ht.abstract: Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity.ht.name: icon
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity.ht.abstract: A URL that refers to the users icon.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity.ht.name: init(from:)
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity.ht.abstract: Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity.ht.name: encode(to:)
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity.ht.abstract: Encodes this value into the given encoder.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity.html.name: id
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity.html.abstract: The unique identifier of a relying party.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity.html.name: icon
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity.html.abstract: A URL that refers to the relying party icon.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.name: challenge
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.abstract: The challenge to be used for generating the newly created credential’s attestation object.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.name: rpId
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.abstract: Represents relying party attributes provided when a credential is created.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.name: allowCredentials
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.abstract: Contains a list of PublicKeyCredentialDescriptor objects representing public key credentials acceptable to the caller.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.name: userVerification
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.abstract: Describes the Relying Party’s requirements regarding user verification for the get() operation.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.name: timeout
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.abstract: The time in milliseconds, that the caller is willing to wait for the call to complete. Default is 30000 milliseconds.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.name: extensions
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.abstract: Represents additional parameters requesting additional processing by the client and authenticator.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.name: init(from:)
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.abstract: Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.name: rp
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.abstract: Represents relying party attributes provided when a credential is created.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.name: user
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.abstract: Represents user account information provided when a credential is created.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.name: challenge
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.abstract: The challenge to be used for generating the newly created credential’s attestation object.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.name: pubKeyCredParams
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.abstract: Represents additional options provided when a credential is created.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.name: timeout
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.abstract: The time in milliseconds, that the caller is willing to wait for the call to complete. Default is 30000 milliseconds.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.name: excludeCredentials
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.abstract: Represents credential parameters to be used for FIDO2 registration or authentication.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.name: authenticatorSelection
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.abstract: Represents configuration items related to the authenticator, which are specified by the WebAuthn relying party.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.name: attestation
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.abstract: Represents credential passing preferences, which are used by the WebAuthn relying party when the credential is created.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.name: extensions
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.abstract: Represents additional parameters requesting additional processing by the client and authenticator.

Structs/AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria.h.name: authenticatorAttachment
Structs/AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria.h.abstract: An enumeration that describes an authenticators’ attachment modalities. Relying parties use this to express a preferred authenticator attachment modality. Default is AuthenticatorAttachment.platform.

Structs/AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria.h.name: requireResidentKey
Structs/AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria.h.abstract: A flag for backwards compatibility with WebAuthn Level 1. Default is false.

Structs/AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria.h.name: userVerification
Structs/AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria.h.abstract: Describes the Relying Party’s requirements regarding user verification for the create() operation. Default is UserVerificationRequirement.preferred.

Structs/AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria.h.name: init(from:)
Structs/AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria.h.abstract: Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder

Structs/AuthenticatorExtensions.html#/s:.name: txAuthSimple
Structs/AuthenticatorExtensions.html#/s:.abstract: A prompt string, intended for display on a trusted device on the authenticator.

Structs/NoneAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.name: format
Structs/NoneAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.abstract: The attestation format of the contextual binding of the authenticator.

Structs/NoneAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.name: statement()
Structs/NoneAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.abstract: Create an attestation statement format which represents a cryptographic signature by an authenticator over a set of contextual bindings.

Structs/BasicAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFI.name: format
Structs/BasicAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFI.abstract: The attestation format of the contextual binding of the authenticator.

Structs/BasicAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFI.name: base64PrivateKey
Structs/BasicAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFI.abstract: A credential private key is the private key portion of a credential key pair. The credential private key is bound to a particular authenticator.

Structs/BasicAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFI.name: base64Certificate
Structs/BasicAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFI.abstract: The private certificate in privacy enhanced mail (PEM) format.

Structs/BasicAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFI.name: clientDataHash
Structs/BasicAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFI.abstract: The hash of the serialized client data.

Structs/BasicAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFI.name: statement()
Structs/BasicAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFI.abstract: Create an attestation statement format which represents a cryptographic signature by an authenticator over a set of contextual bindings.

Structs/SelfAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.name: format
Structs/SelfAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.abstract: The attestation format of the contextual binding of the authenticator.

Structs/SelfAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.name: privateKey
Structs/SelfAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.abstract: A credential private key is the private key portion of a credential key pair. The credential private key is bound to a particular authenticator.

Structs/SelfAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.name: clientDataHash
Structs/SelfAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.abstract: The hash of the serialized client data.

Structs/SelfAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.name: statement()
Structs/SelfAttestation.html#/s:10IBMFID.abstract: Create an attestation statement format which represents a cryptographic signature by an authenticator over a set of contextual bindings.

Structs/SelfAttestation.html.name: SelfAttestation
Structs/SelfAttestation.html.abstract: Self attestation where, the authenticator does not have any specific attestation key pair. Instead it uses the credential private key to create the attestation signature. Authenticators without meaningful protection measures for an attestation private key typically use this attestation type.

Structs/BasicAttestation.html.name: BasicAttestation
Structs/BasicAttestation.html.abstract: A X.509 Certificate for the attestation key pair used by an authenticator to attest to its origin for example self-signed certificates or certificates generated via white box encryption. At registration time, the authenticator uses the attestation private key to sign the Relying Party-specific credential public key (and additional data) that it generates and returns via the authenticatorMakeCredential operation.

Structs/NoneAttestation.html.name: NoneAttestation
Structs/NoneAttestation.html.abstract: The none attestation statement format is used to replace any authenticator-provided attestation statement when a WebAuthn Relying Party indicates it does not wish to receive attestation information.

Structs/AuthenticatorExtensions.html.name: AuthenticatorExtensions
Structs/AuthenticatorExtensions.html.abstract: An extension involves communication with and processing by the client.

Structs/AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria.h.name: AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria
Structs/AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria.h.abstract: WebAuthn Relying Parties may use the AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria dictionary to specify their requirements regarding authenticator attributes.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.name: PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptions
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptio.abstract: Represents options provided when an authentication credential is created.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.name: PublicKeyCredentialRequestOptions
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOption.abstract: The PublicKeyCredentialRequestOptions supplies get() with the data it needs to generate an assertion.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity.html.name: PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialRpEntity.html.abstract: Represents relying party attributes provided when a credential is created.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity.ht.name: PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity.ht.abstract: Represents user account information provided when a credential is created.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialParameters.ht.name: PublicKeyCredentialParameters
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialParameters.ht.abstract: Represents additional parameters when creating a new credential.

Structs/PublicKeyCredentialDescriptor.ht.name: PublicKeyCredentialDescriptor
Structs/PublicKeyCredentialDescriptor.ht.abstract: Represents credential parameters to be used for FIDO2 registration or authentication.

Structs/AuthenticatorAttestationResponse.name: AuthenticatorAttestationResponse
Structs/AuthenticatorAttestationResponse.abstract: The AuthenticatorAttestationResponse struct represents the authenticator’s response to a client’s request for the creation of a new public key credential. It contains information about the new credential that can be used to identify it for later use, and metadata that can be used by the WebAuthn Relying Party to assess the characteristics of the credential during registration.

Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.name: AuthenticatorAssertionResponse
Structs/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse.h.abstract: This structure contains cryptographic signatures produced by scoped credentials that provides proof of possession of a private key as well as evidence of user consent to a specific transaction.

Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html.name: PublicKeyCredential
Structs/PublicKeyCredential.html.abstract: The PublicKeyCredential protocol contains the attributes that are returned to the caller when a new credential is created, or a new assertion is requested.

Protocols/PublicKeyCredentialDelegate.ht.name: publicKeyCredential(provider:didCompleteWithError:)
Protocols/PublicKeyCredentialDelegate.ht.abstract: Tells the delegate when an attestion or assertion attempt fails, and provides an error explaining why.

Protocols/PublicKeyCredentialDelegate.ht.name: publicKeyCredential(provider:didCompleteWithAttestation:)
Protocols/PublicKeyCredentialDelegate.ht.abstract: Tells the delegate when attestation attempt completes successfully.

Protocols/PublicKeyCredentialDelegate.ht.name: publicKeyCredential(provider:didCompleteWithAssertion:)
Protocols/PublicKeyCredentialDelegate.ht.abstract: Tells the delegate when attestation attempt completes successfully.

Protocols/AuthenticatorResponse.html#/s:.name: clientDataJSON
Protocols/AuthenticatorResponse.html#/s:.abstract: Contains the JSON of the client data, the hash of which is passed to the authenticator by the client in its call to either WebAuthnAPIClient.create() or WebAuthnAPIClient.get()

Protocols/PackedAttestionStatementProvid.name: clientDataHash
Protocols/PackedAttestionStatementProvid.abstract: The hash of the serialized client data.

Protocols/AttestionStatementProvider.htm.name: format
Protocols/AttestionStatementProvider.htm.abstract: The attestation format of the contextual binding of the authenticator.

Protocols/AttestionStatementProvider.htm.name: statement()
Protocols/AttestionStatementProvider.htm.abstract: Create an attestation statement format which represents a cryptographic signature by an authenticator over a set of contextual bindings.

Protocols/AttestionStatementProvider.htm.name: AttestionStatementProvider
Protocols/AttestionStatementProvider.htm.abstract: Declares that a type can generate an attestation format.

Protocols/PackedAttestionStatementProvid.name: PackedAttestionStatementProvider
Protocols/PackedAttestionStatementProvid.abstract: This is a WebAuthn optimized attestation statement format. It uses a very compact but still extensible encoding method.

Protocols/AuthenticatorResponse.html.name: AuthenticatorResponse
Protocols/AuthenticatorResponse.html.abstract: Authenticators respond to relying party requests by returning an object derived from this protocol.

Protocols/PublicKeyCredentialDelegate.ht.name: PublicKeyCredentialDelegate
Protocols/PublicKeyCredentialDelegate.ht.abstract: An interface for providing information about the outcome of an attestation or assertion attempt.

Extensions/UUID.html#/s:10Foundation4UUI.name: empty
Extensions/UUID.html#/s:10Foundation4UUI.abstract: Returns a UUID whose structure is all zeros.

Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html#/s:1.name: invalidAttestationData
Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html#/s:1.abstract: Authentication data or client data hash is invalid.

Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html#/s:1.name: invalidPrivateKeyData
Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html#/s:1.abstract: The private key data provided was invalid.

Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html#/s:1.name: unableToCreateKey
Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html#/s:1.abstract: A private key could not be created from the the private key data.

Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html#/s:1.name: unableToCreateSignature
Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html#/s:1.abstract: Unable to create a signature based on the private key and attestation data.

Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html#/s:1.name: timeout
Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html#/s:1.abstract: The time allocated to complete the operation has expired.

Enums/UserVerificationRequirement.html#/.name: required
Enums/UserVerificationRequirement.html#/.abstract: This value indicates that the relying party requires user verification for the operation and will fail the operation if the response does not have the UV flag set.

Enums/UserVerificationRequirement.html#/.name: preferred
Enums/UserVerificationRequirement.html#/.abstract: This value indicates that the relying party prefers user verification for the operation if possible, but will not fail the operation if the response does not have the UV flag set.

Enums/UserVerificationRequirement.html#/.name: discouraged
Enums/UserVerificationRequirement.html#/.abstract: This value indicates that the Relying Party does not want user verification employed during the operation (e.g., in the interest of minimizing disruption to the user interaction flow).

Enums/AuthenticatorAttachment.html#/s:10.name: platform
Enums/AuthenticatorAttachment.html#/s:10.abstract: A platform authenticator is attached using a client device-specific transport, called platform attachment, and is usually not removable from the client device.

Enums/AuthenticatorAttachment.html#/s:10.name: crossPlatform
Enums/AuthenticatorAttachment.html#/s:10.abstract: A cross-platform attachment are removable authenticator from, and can “roam” between, client devices.

Enums/AuthenticatorTransport.html#/s:10I.name: usb
Enums/AuthenticatorTransport.html#/s:10I.abstract: Authenticator can be contacted over removable USB.

Enums/AuthenticatorTransport.html#/s:10I.name: nfc
Enums/AuthenticatorTransport.html#/s:10I.abstract: Authenticator can be contacted over Near Field Communication (NFC).

Enums/AuthenticatorTransport.html#/s:10I.name: ble
Enums/AuthenticatorTransport.html#/s:10I.abstract: Authenticator can be contacted over Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE).

Enums/AuthenticatorTransport.html#/s:10I.name: internal
Enums/AuthenticatorTransport.html#/s:10I.abstract: Authenticator is contacted using a client device-specific transport, i.e a platform authenticator. These authenticators are not removable from the client device.

Enums/COSEAlgorithmIdentifier.html#/s:10.name: parse(from:)
Enums/COSEAlgorithmIdentifier.html#/s:10.abstract: Gets the COSE value for the algorithm used in the encryption of the credential.

Enums/AttestationConveyancePreference.ht.name: none
Enums/AttestationConveyancePreference.ht.abstract: This value indicates that the relying party is not interested in authenticator attestation.

Enums/AttestationConveyancePreference.ht.name: indirect
Enums/AttestationConveyancePreference.ht.abstract: This value indicates that the relying party prefers an attestation conveyance yielding verifiable attestation object, but allows the client to decide how to obtain such an attestation object.

Enums/AttestationConveyancePreference.ht.name: direct
Enums/AttestationConveyancePreference.ht.abstract: This value indicates that the relying party wants to receive the attestation object as generated by the authenticator.

Enums/PublicKeyCredentialType.html.name: PublicKeyCredentialType
Enums/PublicKeyCredentialType.html.abstract: An enumeration for defining valid credential types.

Enums/AttestationConveyancePreference.ht.name: AttestationConveyancePreference
Enums/AttestationConveyancePreference.ht.abstract: An enumeraton for defining credential passing preferences, which are used by the WebAuthn relying party when the credential is created.

Enums/COSEAlgorithmIdentifier.html.name: COSEAlgorithmIdentifier
Enums/COSEAlgorithmIdentifier.html.abstract: The value of a COSEAlgorithmIdentifier is a number identifying a cryptographic algorithm.

Enums/AuthenticatorTransport.html.name: AuthenticatorTransport
Enums/AuthenticatorTransport.html.abstract: An enumeration that defines how clients might communicate with an authenticator in order to obtain an assertion for a specific credential.

Enums/AuthenticatorAttachment.html.name: AuthenticatorAttachment
Enums/AuthenticatorAttachment.html.abstract: An enumeration that describes an authenticators’ attachment modalities. Relying parties use this to express a preferred authenticator attachment modality.

Enums/UserVerificationRequirement.html.name: UserVerificationRequirement
Enums/UserVerificationRequirement.html.abstract: An enumeration a WebAuthn relying party may require for user verification for some of its operations but not for others, and may use this type to express its needs.

Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html.name: PublicKeyCredentialError
Enums/PublicKeyCredentialError.html.abstract: A type that indicates when Fido2ApiClient encounters an error.

Classes/PublicKeyCredentialProvider.html.name: delegate
Classes/PublicKeyCredentialProvider.html.abstract: A delegate that the public key provider informs about the success or failure of an attestation or assertion attempt.

Classes/PublicKeyCredentialProvider.html.name: createCredentialAttestationRequest(_:statementProvider:options:)
Classes/PublicKeyCredentialProvider.html.abstract: Creates a public key credential registration request with the authenticator identifier, attestation format provider and options representing the request.

Classes/PublicKeyCredentialProvider.html.name: createCredentialAssertionRequest(options:clientDataParams:)
Classes/PublicKeyCredentialProvider.html.abstract: Creates an assertion request with request options and additional client data parameters.

Classes/PublicKeyCredentialProvider.html.name: PublicKeyCredentialProvider
Classes/PublicKeyCredentialProvider.html.abstract: Platform authentication for providing public key credential requests to an app using the W3C Web Authentication specification.
